studies.title: Comparative agreement among traditional, digital, and experimental AI-based shade selection methods in dentistry: A clinical study
studies.keyFindings: A statistically moderate agreement was found between the traditional method and intraoral scanner (kappa=.421; P<.001), while a very low agreement was shown among the four methods (Fleiss kappa=.071, P<.05).

studies.title: Alveolar Bone Segmentation Methods in Assessing the Effectiveness of Periodontal Defect Regeneration Through Machine Learning of CBCT Data: A Systematic Review
studies.keyFindings: Deep learning methods, particularly U-Net, were most frequently employed for alveolar bone segmentation, with a DC index ranging from 76% to 98% indicating significant differences between healthy and defective bone.

studies.title: Unlocking predictive genetic factors with artificial intelligence: relationship between dental impaction and hypodontia evaluated via association-rule algorithms: a case-control study
studies.keyFindings: Association-rule mining identified notable genotype patterns with the MSX1 A/A genotype (support=0.224, confidence=0.827, lift=1.475), with the combination of PAX9 (C/C) and MSX1 (A/A) having the highest predictive value (lift=1.671).

studies.title: Buccal or palatal? AI-based localization of impacted maxillary canines using panoramic radiographs
studies.keyFindings: AI-based localization of impacted maxillary canines using panoramic radiographs demonstrates potential for improved diagnostic accuracy.

studies.title: Intra-oral camera utilisation: a multi-perspective study on applications, challenges and future directions
studies.keyFindings: IOCs enhance diagnostic accuracy, improve patient education, and streamline documentation, but face challenges such as technical issues and high costs.

studies.title: Quality of Conventional versus Artificial Intelligence Oral Surgery Consent Forms: Comparative Analysis
studies.keyFindings: Artificial intelligence-generated informed consent forms for oral surgery demonstrated higher quality and better readability than conventional web-based forms.

studies.title: Beyond overconfidence: Embedding curiosity and humility for ethical medical AI
studies.keyFindings: The BODHI framework introduces curiosity and humility as essential design principles for medical AI, aiming to enhance clinical decision-making and address systemic failures in AI deployment.

studies.title: Decoding Temporomandibular Disorders: Identifying Stage-Specific and Functional Patterns in the Articular Disc
studies.keyFindings: The review identified 24 biomarkers in 511 patients and 132 controls, classifying them according to functional and stage-specific patterns to enhance understanding of TMD progression.

studies.title: "Now you're talking my language" - Improving health literacy and patient-directed knowledge of scientific abstracts through provision of plain language summaries created by artificial intelligence: A cross sectional infodemiology study
studies.keyFindings: AI-created plain language summaries improved readability scores to mean values of 59.8±7.4 with minimal prompts and 71.3±6.1 with extensive prompts, allowing 96% of abstracts to meet reference readability targets.

studies.title: Assessing public interest in artificial intelligence in dermatology: A Google Trends analysis
studies.keyFindings: Public interest in AI dermatology terms increased markedly after 2022, with growth of 73.6%, 143.6%, and 59.1% in 2022, 2023, and 2024, respectively.
studies.journal: JID innovations : skin science from molecules to population health

studies.title: Robotic nanoparticle delivery systems for tumor hyperthermia: clinical readiness and challenges
studies.keyFindings: Robotic nanoparticle delivery systems, such as Germany's MagForce Nanotherm® device for glioblastoma, highlight advances in precision oncology while facing challenges like consistent dosing and nanoparticle biosafety.

studies.title: Advanced imaging integration in robotic neurosurgery
studies.keyFindings: Advanced robotic platforms integrating real-time imaging improve precision in neurosurgery, demonstrating superior targeting accuracy and reduced operative time.

studies.title: Advancements in metastatic spinal cord compression treatment: a narrative review of innovations, challenges, and future directions
studies.keyFindings: Effective care of metastatic spinal cord compression includes high-dose corticosteroids, surgery, and radiation therapy, with advancements such as robot-assisted surgeries and precision medicine techniques enhancing outcomes.

studies.title: Accuracy of dentalmonitoring's artificial intelligence in detecting aligner tracking issues: a retrospective multi-centric study
studies.keyFindings: DM's AI achieved a sensitivity of 93.2% and specificity of 86.2% for detecting aligner unseat events, indicating high reliability in ruling out clinically meaningful issues.

studies.title: Extracellular Vesicles in Osteogenesis: Comparative Analysis of Stem Cell Sources, Conditioning Strategies, and In Vitro Models Toward Advanced Bone Regeneration
studies.keyFindings: The review highlights the potential of extracellular vesicles (EVs) from various stem cell sources as mediators of osteogenesis for bone regeneration.

studies.title: Evaluation of Large Language Model-Based Chatbots for Dental Trauma Management: A Comparative Study Based on Accuracy, Consistency and Information Quality
studies.keyFindings: Perplexity showed the highest accuracy for true/false questions, while ChatGPT excelled in readability, and all chatbots achieved acceptable global quality scores (> 4.4).
studies.journal: Australian endodontic journal : the journal of the Australian Society of Endodontology Inc

studies.title: AI-Powered Predictive Models in Implant Dentistry: Planning, Risk Assessment, and Outcomes
studies.keyFindings: AI technologies enhance treatment stages in implant dentistry, including risk assessment and outcome prediction.

studies.title: Oral Health Assessment in Adolescents with End-Stage Chronic Kidney Disease
studies.keyFindings: Adolescents with end-stage chronic kidney disease showed increased periodontal indices and oral dysbiosis compared to healthy adolescents, despite similar DMFT scores.

studies.title: Effect of propolis and honey in hyperglycemia-induced kidney and liver injuries, proteinuria, and oxidant and antioxidant parameters
studies.keyFindings: Propolis, honey, or their combination significantly ameliorated hyperglycemia, acute kidney injury, proteinuria, liver injury, and dyslipidemia induced by D-glucose.

studies.title: Diagnostic accuracy of artificial intelligence in determining extraction protocol in orthodontic patients: A systematic review
studies.keyFindings: Neural networks and classifier models demonstrated a high level of accuracy ranging from 82% to 94% in determining the optimal tooth extraction protocol.

studies.title: Comparative Evaluation of Craniofacial Growth Patterns Using AI-Driven Longitudinal Cephalometric Superimpositions in Adolescents
studies.keyFindings: AI analysis showed significant differences in mandibular length increase among growth pattern groups, with vertical growers having the highest increase in lower anterior facial height.

studies.title: Diagnostic Performance of AI-Powered Histopathology: Can Machines Match Oral Pathologists in Identifying Epithelial Dysplasia?
studies.keyFindings: AI achieved >93% diagnostic accuracy in identifying and grading oral epithelial dysplasia.

studies.title: Development and Comparative Analysis of an AI Based Convolutional Neural Network Algorithm versus Dentists of Varying Experience in Detecting Dental Caries using Bitewing X-ray Images: An In vitro Study
studies.keyFindings: The AI model demonstrated a precision of 0.87, recall of 0.77, and F1 score of 0.82, outperforming dentists in detecting dental caries.

studies.title: Evaluation of Artificial Intelligence-Based Diagnostic Tools for Accurate Detection and Classification of Oral Lesions: A Clinical Study
studies.keyFindings: The AI system achieved an overall diagnostic accuracy of 91.1%, sensitivity of 93.6%, and specificity of 89.2%, demonstrating substantial concordance with histopathological diagnosis.

studies.title: Diagnostic Accuracy and Efficiency of AI-Assisted Radiographic Interpretation Compared to Conventional Methods in Early Detection of Dental Caries
studies.keyFindings: AI-assisted interpretation showed significantly higher sensitivity (91.2% ± 3.5) and overall diagnostic accuracy (89.4% ± 3.2) compared to conventional interpretation.

studies.title: Knowledge, Attitudes, and Practices of Artificial Intelligence in Dentistry: A cross-sectional survey
studies.keyFindings: 95.6% of respondents were familiar with AI, but most displayed insufficient knowledge about its application in dentistry, with significant differences between undergraduates and postgraduates.

studies.title: Laboratory-Based Additive Modifications in Glass Ionomer Cements: A Scoping Review Using a Systematic Data Mining and Trend Analysis Framework (2015-2024)
studies.keyFindings: The incorporation of nano-sized metals or bioactive glass or glass fiber in glass ionomer cements may enhance their bioactivity.

studies.title: An artificial intelligence-assisted automated quantitative evaluation system for condylar morphological changes of temporomandibular joint
studies.keyFindings: The AI-assisted quantitative evaluation system achieved Dice similarity coefficients of 0.988, 0.986, and 0.981 for normal and type I and II osteoarthritis condyles, respectively.

studies.title: Web-based AI application for enhanced dental disease diagnosis using advanced object detection integrated with transformer-based attention mechanism
studies.keyFindings: The YOLOv11-TAM model achieved about a 15% increase in precision and a specificity of 0.92 in detecting dental diseases from panoramic X-ray images.

studies.title: How Accurate Are the Responses of 4 AI Chatbots to Orthognathic Surgery Questions?
studies.keyFindings: DeepSeek-v3 demonstrated the highest proportion of objectively true responses (87.3%) compared to ChatGPT-4, Gemini, and Copilot.

studies.title: AKUDENTAL teeth instance segmentation dataset: a cross-dataset analysis
studies.keyFindings: Unclear (abstract-limited)

studies.title: Application of artificial intelligence and radiomics in the prediction of lymph node metastasis and tumour grading of oral cancer - a systematic review and meta analysis
studies.keyFindings: The pooled sensitivity, specificity, and Diagnostic Odds Ratio of the AI models for the prediction of lymph node metastases were 0.86, 0.91, and 56.58 respectively.

studies.title: Ethical considerations of artificial intelligence in emergency medicine for triage and resource allocation: a scoping review
studies.keyFindings: The selected literature raised various ethical and legal issues related to the introduction of AI triage systems and AI utilization in emergency medicine.

studies.title: The Outcome of Intracellular Selenomonas sputigena and its Impact on Gingival Keratinocytes
studies.keyFindings: Selenomonas sputigena can be taken into gingival keratinocytes, inducing inflammatory responses, but is ultimately processed by lysosomal machinery and cleared from GECs.

studies.title: Adapt VR in dental education: boosting preclinical skill and self-confidence
studies.keyFindings: Third-year dental students trained with the Adapt VR system before laboratory simulation achieved significantly higher laboratory scores (6.31 vs. 3.93; p < 0.001) and reported increased self-confidence compared to those trained with conventional manikin-based methods.

studies.title: Immunopathological outcomes are isolate-dependent in chronic Mycobacterium avium complex pulmonary disease
studies.keyFindings: Chronic Mycobacterium avium complex pulmonary disease in mice produces distinct immunopathological and respiratory outcomes depending on the MAC isolate used.

studies.title: Leading large language models on a periodontology knowledge test
studies.keyFindings: Four large language models achieved an overall accuracy of 65.0% (95% CI: 63.4-66.6%) on a 50-question periodontology knowledge test, with no significant performance differences between models or after role-specific priming.
studies.studyDesign: Benchmarking study on validated multiple-choice question set

studies.title: Predicting the Severity of Postoperative Symptoms Following Mandibular Third Molar Extractions Using Machine Learning Techniques
studies.keyFindings: A GBM machine learning model predicted postoperative symptom severity after mandibular third molar extraction (AUROC 0.687) in 18–35-year-olds, with operative time, mouth opening, PGV, PGL, smoking, and preoperative symptoms as top predictors.
studies.studyDesign: Retrospective cohort study with random train/validation split and internal model validation

studies.title: Artificial Intelligence-Based McNamara Analysis of Different Types of Cleft and Non-Cleft Individuals
studies.keyFindings: Artificial intelligence-based McNamara cephalometric analysis found significant differences in skeletal parameters between non-cleft and cleft individuals, and among cleft subtypes, but no significant gender differences, in a sample of 123 individuals.

studies.title: Artificial intelligence for detection and classification of furcation defects using radiographic imaging: A systematic review
studies.keyFindings: AI algorithms, especially advanced deep learning models applied to 2D dental radiographs, generally demonstrate high diagnostic accuracy for detecting furcation defects, though performance varies by model and modality.

studies.title: Exploration and Practice of Constructing a New Ecology of Experimental Stomatology Practice Teaching Driven by Digital Intelligence
studies.keyFindings: The implementation of an AI-augmented, digitally driven experimental teaching system in stomatology reportedly improves students' self-directed learning, clinical precision, and interdisciplinary diagnostic reasoning.
studies.journal: Sichuan da xue xue bao. Yi xue ban = Journal of Sichuan University. Medical science edition

studies.title: Advancements in Predicting Periodontal Disease Evolution: A Narrative Review of Contemporary Clinical Risk Prediction Systems
studies.keyFindings: This narrative review critically analyzes the evolution, structure, validation evidence, and clinical applicability of major periodontal risk prediction systems, highlighting recent advances including the integration of artificial intelligence-driven algorithms and digital data capture.

studies.title: Harnessing AI in prosthodontics and implant dentistry: An umbrella review of systematic evidence
studies.keyFindings: AI shows substantial capability in prosthodontics and implant dentistry for tasks such as radiographic recognition (up to 95.6% accuracy) and caries/fracture detection (82%-89%), but most evidence is early-stage and not yet practice-ready.
studies.journal: Journal of prosthodontics : official journal of the American College of Prosthodontists

studies.title: Boosting angiogenesis experimentally in ovo by biofunctionalizing collagen membranes with platelet-rich fibrin and hyaluronic acid: implications for regenerative oral surgery?
studies.keyFindings: Biofunctionalization of collagen membranes with A-PRF and i-PRF significantly enhanced angiogenesis in ovo compared to native membranes, with effects sustained up to 96 hours, while HA also promoted angiogenesis but to a lesser extent.

studies.title: Impact of Labeling Inaccuracy and Image Noise on Tooth Segmentation in Panoramic Radiographs using Federated, Centralized and Local Learning
studies.keyFindings: Federated learning matched or outperformed centralized and local learning for tooth segmentation in panoramic radiographs under multiple data corruption scenarios, achieving median Dice scores up to 0.94889 and demonstrating robust performance across all tested conditions.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: An explainable and transparent machine learning approach for predicting dental caries: a cross-national validation study
studies.keyFindings: An XGBoost model for predicting dental caries achieved an internal validation AUC of 0.785 (95% CI 0.756-0.813), but performance dropped to an AUC of 0.550 (95% CI 0.532-0.569) during external validation, with notably poor sensitivity.
studies.studyDesign: External validation study on independent test set

studies.title: Artificial intelligence performance in maxillary canine impaction: a systematic review
studies.keyFindings: This systematic review of seven studies found that artificial intelligence achieved high diagnostic accuracy (up to 98.3%) and efficient segmentation (Dice similarity coefficient 0.99) for maxillary canine impaction, with moderate-to-high predictive performance for eruption outcomes.

studies.title: Mechanistic diversity of Bacteroides fragilis toxins and neutralization with single domain antibody
studies.keyFindings: A single-domain antibody, Nb2.43, was identified that can neutralize all three BFT subtypes by binding the metalloenzyme catalytic zinc ion and prevent BFT-induced damage in vitro and in a mouse colitis model.

studies.title: Deep Learning-Based Detection of Periodontal Infrabony and Furcation Defects on Periapical Radiographs: A Feasibility Study
studies.keyFindings: A deep learning model trained on 581 annotated periapical radiographs achieved a precision of 0.592, recall of 0.435, and mAP@0.5 of 0.504 for detecting and classifying periodontal osseous defects.

studies.title: AI-Assisted Multiplex SYBR Green I-Based qPCR for the Identification and Quantitative Analysis of Oral Microbiota
studies.keyFindings: The developed AI-integrated VC-PCR system for multiplex pathogen detection in oral microbiota achieved 100% semiquantitative accuracy in duplex assays, over 90% semiquantitative accuracy in triplex assays, and provided qualitative results with high sensitivity under optimized laboratory conditions.

studies.title: Artificial Intelligence-Assisted Clinical Decision Model for Managing Retained Second Deciduous Molars With No Permanent Successors
studies.keyFindings: The Random Forest classifier achieved the highest accuracy among four machine learning models in aiding clinical decision-making for managing retained second deciduous molars with no permanent successors, with key predictors including patient preference, mandibular arch crowding, and ankylosis.

studies.title: Editorial: Special issue on application of artificial intelligence in oral and craniofacial care
studies.keyFindings: The editorial introduces a special issue on the application of artificial intelligence in oral and craniofacial care.
studies.journal: Journal of oral biology and craniofacial research

studies.title: To Remove or Not Remove Non-Conventional Dental Implants? Eleven-Year Retrospective Study on Implant Outcomes
studies.keyFindings: Over eleven years, 503 dental implants were removed from 264 patients, including 40 non-conventional designs, with broken osseointegrated and basal implants presenting significant removal challenges and risk of bone defects.
studies.journal: Clinical implant dentistry and related research

studies.title: Development of a novel method for estimating the missing mandible using three-dimensional homologous models
studies.keyFindings: A method using homologous models and principal component regression estimated three-dimensional mandibular shape from cranial CT images of 200 Japanese subjects, with a mean error of 2.324 ± 0.659 mm compared to ground truth.

studies.title: Quality and Reliability of AI Information on Dental Implant Failure: A Comparative Multi-Model Analysis
studies.keyFindings: Among four widely used AI chatbots evaluated for dental implant failure information, Gemini achieved the highest accuracy, ChatGPT-4 the highest reliability, Copilot the greatest fluency, and DeepSeek-R1 the best readability, with significant intermodel variability (Gemini accuracy, P<0.001).
studies.studyDesign: Comparative benchmarking study of AI chatbot responses using expert-validated questions

studies.title: Personalized Learning With Artificial Intelligence in Dental Education: An Integrative Review
studies.keyFindings: This integrative review discusses various artificial intelligence tools used to personalize dental education and highlights both the advantages and areas for improvement based on the synthesis of a narrowed body of reviewed studies.

studies.title: Perceptions of dental students on the integration of artificial intelligence in radiology clinical education
studies.keyFindings: Most surveyed dental students reported that AI improved caries detection (89.4%) and radiographic interpretation (92.4%), but only 16.7% felt adequately prepared by the curriculum to use AI clinically.

studies.title: Beyond Algorithmic Safety: Reclaiming Moral Agency in the Era of Clinical AI
studies.keyFindings: The title suggests a discussion on reclaiming moral agency beyond algorithmic safety in clinical AI.

studies.title: Towards automated model analysis: A multiview AI segmentation of 3D dental scans
studies.keyFindings: An AI-based multiview segmentation model achieved mIoU scores of 93.1% on a public test set and 90.7% on a clinical test set, with corresponding DICE scores of 95.7% and 94.9%, demonstrating generalization to real-world intraoral scans.
studies.journal: Journal of the World federation of orthodontists
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Clinical Accuracy of AI Language Models in Providing Impacted Teeth Information: A Comparative Evaluation
studies.keyFindings: ChatGPT-4 provided 'Objectively True' responses to 83.9% of 118 expert-generated questions about impacted teeth, outperforming Gemini and Copilot in clinical accuracy across all domains assessed.

studies.title: Matrix Metalloproteinases in Periodontal and Peri-Implant Diseases: Contribution to Their Pathogenesis, Diagnosis, and Treatment
studies.keyFindings: Matrix metalloproteinases, particularly MMP-8 and MMP-9, are elevated in periodontitis and peri-implantitis, serving as potential biomarkers with point-of-care tests showing 70%-85% sensitivity and 65%-80% specificity for periodontitis detection, and therapeutic modulation strategies such as subantimicrobial dose doxycycline achieve 40%-60% reduction in clinical attachment loss.

studies.title: Adjunctive Therapies in Periodontitis: Current Concepts and the Future
studies.keyFindings: This narrative review synthesizes evidence on translational research methodologies and adjunctive therapies in periodontitis, highlighting the need for harmonized models, standardized outcomes, and innovative diagnostic and therapeutic strategies.

studies.title: Blended peer-led research curriculum with AI integration improves postgraduate students' academic performance and satisfaction: a quasi-experimental mixed-methods study
studies.keyFindings: A blended peer-led research curriculum with AI integration improves postgraduate students' academic performance and satisfaction.

studies.title: Evaluation of ChatGPT-4 and Microsoft Copilot for Third-Molar Assessment on Panoramic Radiographs
studies.keyFindings: ChatGPT-4 and Microsoft Copilot demonstrated low performance, with mean overall scores of 0.22 (SD=0.42) and 0.28 (SD=0.46) respectively, in identifying and classifying the position of third molars on 100 panoramic radiographs covering 114 third molars.
studies.journal: Journal of imaging informatics in medicine

studies.title: Development of a Deep Learning Algorithm for Posterior Fossa Abnormality Recognition on First-Trimester US Screening Scans: AIRFRAME Study Part 1
studies.keyFindings: A deep learning algorithm achieved an AUC of 0.94 and an accuracy of 88% for detecting posterior fossa abnormalities on first-trimester US scans using an internal test set from international retrospective multicenter data.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Artificial Intelligence Helps Diagnose Oral Potentially Malignant Disorders: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
studies.keyFindings: AI-based diagnostic tools for oral potentially malignant disorders demonstrate high sensitivity (0.94) and specificity (0.95) using intraoral photographs compared to histology as the reference.

studies.title: The role of artificial intelligence in the authorship of scientific articles in dentistry: ethical approaches for responsible use
studies.keyFindings: The article discusses ethical approaches for responsible use of artificial intelligence in the authorship of scientific articles in dentistry.
studies.journal: Revista cientifica odontologica (Universidad Cientifica del Sur)

studies.title: Large language model bias auditing for periodontal diagnosis using an ambiguity-probe methodology: a pilot study
studies.keyFindings: GPT-4o showed higher diagnostic accuracy (70.5%) compared to Gemini Pro (33.3%) in clear-cut scenarios, but neither model exhibited statistically significant sociodemographic bias across 630 vignette-persona combinations.

studies.title: Dental Crowding Categorization Network (DCC-Net): Explainable deep learning system for automatic categorization of dental crowding on intraoral photographs
studies.keyFindings: DCC-Net categorized dental crowding on intraoral photographs with accuracies of 0.7232 (maxilla) and 0.7352 (mandible), and improved junior orthodontists' diagnostic accuracy by 9.18% and 12.75% in maxilla and mandible, respectively.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study with external test set and human–AI comparison

studies.title: Comparative evaluation of ChatGPT, Gemini, and Grok in clinical decision-making and general knowledge assessment for impacted maxillary canines
studies.keyFindings: ChatGPT and Grok showed moderate agreement with orthodontists on treatment decisions for impacted maxillary canines, while Gemini had significantly more discordant responses and lower clinical alignment.

studies.title: Comment on "Diagnostic Performance of Multimodal Large Language Models in the Analysis of Oral Pathology"
studies.keyFindings: No key finding can be determined as only a comment on another study is present.

studies.title: Explainable artificial intelligence system using a convolutional neural network for designing major connectors of removable partial denture framework
studies.keyFindings: A convolutional neural network-based AI system predicted major connector types for removable partial dentures with reported accuracies of 87.1%–93.0% and utilized Grad-CAM for interpretability.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Multi-dimensional attention-enhanced reconstruction for sparse-view CBCT
studies.keyFindings: The proposed MAE-Recon algorithm improved RMSE, SSIM, and PSNR scores for sparse-view CBCT image reconstruction on a real chest dataset and a simulated abdomen dataset.

studies.title: A hybrid MMBERT framework for classifying periodontal bone loss: Integrating visual and textual information
studies.keyFindings: A hybrid MMBERT model integrating image and text data achieved a test accuracy of 100% for classifying periodontal bone loss in a dataset of 150 intraoral periapical radiographs.
studies.journal: Journal of oral biology and craniofacial research
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Generalizability of YOLOv11 models for mesiodens detection in pediatric panoramic radiographs
studies.keyFindings: The study investigated the generalizability of YOLOv11 models for detecting mesiodens in pediatric panoramic radiographs.

studies.title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Multi-Stage System for Automated Angle's Classification of Malocclusion from Intraoral Images in Orthodontics
studies.keyFindings: A multi-stage deep learning pipeline achieved perfect side classification and high external accuracy for Angle's classification of occlusion in intraoral photos, with external performance of 97.41% accuracy and class-wise sensitivity/specificity up to 99.0%/98.9%.
studies.journal: Journal of imaging informatics in medicine
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and validation with internal and external test sets

studies.title: PMCanalSeg: A dataset for automatic segmentation of the pterygopalatine and mandibular canals from 3D CBCT images
studies.keyFindings: The authors created and released a public dataset of 191 maxillofacial CBCT cases with annotations for pterygopalatine and mandibular canal segmentation, representing the first such dataset to include the maxillary pterygopalatine canal.

studies.title: Performance of GPT-5, DeepSeek, and Claude in dental MCQs for medically compromised patients
studies.keyFindings: No abstract provided; key findings cannot be determined.

studies.title: Exploring the intricate interplay between metabolic abnormalities and multidimensional cognitive impairment in stable schizophrenia patients
studies.keyFindings: Metabolic syndrome components, particularly dyslipidemia and hypertension, are associated with multidimensional cognitive impairment in 727 stable schizophrenia patients across ten hospitals, with a transformer-based machine learning model effectively predicting cognitive dimensions.

studies.title: Machine Learning Model for Predicting Postoperative Pain in Cases of Irreversible Pulpitis
studies.keyFindings: Machine learning models, particularly Logistic Regression and Support Vector Machine, showed good performance in predicting postoperative pain in 354 irreversible pulpitis cases (AUC up to 0.81, precision up to 0.88).
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: An exploratory study on the effectiveness of AI detection tools in identifying AI-generated articles
studies.keyFindings: QuillBot showed perfect detection of human-written articles and Copyleaks performed best at detecting AI-generated articles (mean score 99.6/100), among eight evaluated AI detection tools on 24 human-written and 12 AI-generated oral and maxillofacial surgery articles.
studies.journal: International journal of oral and maxillofacial surgery

studies.title: Evaluation of the performance of four different large language models (ChatGPT, DeepSeek, Copilot, and Gemini) in answering oral, and maxillofacial radiology questions: pilot study
studies.keyFindings: ChatGPT achieved the highest overall accuracy among four large language models in answering 240 multiple-choice questions on oral and maxillofacial radiology, with 90.5% accuracy for text-based and 90.0% for image-based questions.
studies.studyDesign: Pilot study benchmarking LLMs on multiple-choice questions

studies.title: An interdisciplinary framework for artificial intelligence, precision medicine, and ethical governance in periodontal care: a systematic review - recent update
studies.keyFindings: The review proposes an interdisciplinary framework for integrating artificial intelligence, precision medicine, and ethical governance in periodontal care.

studies.title: Artificial intelligence for binary dental caries diagnosis using intraoral images and dental radiographs: a systematic review and meta-analysis
studies.keyFindings: AI models achieved pooled sensitivity, specificity, and AUC of 0.86, 0.91, and 0.94, respectively, for binary dental caries diagnosis across intraoral images and radiographs, but estimates should be interpreted with caution due to high heterogeneity and study quality limitations.

studies.title: The role of large language models in dental diagnosis, decision-making, and communication: A systematic review
studies.keyFindings: Of 1142 records screened, 38 studies on LLMs in dentistry were included, most involving ChatGPT-3.5, with outcomes suggesting potential for increased efficiency and improved patient care, but risk of incorrect or incomplete information remains.

studies.title: Comparative performance of ChatGPT, Gemini, and Deepseek on endodontic exam questions in Turkish and English
studies.keyFindings: The study compares the performance of ChatGPT, Gemini, and Deepseek on endodontic exam questions in Turkish and English.

studies.title: Dentists' awareness of data security and ethical issues during the transition to artificial intelligence-driven clinical practice
studies.keyFindings: Among 257 dentists in Türkiye, awareness of AI-related ethical and data security issues varied by workplace and professional experience, with university hospital dentists reporting the highest awareness (mean domain scores: 2.97 to 3.13).

studies.title: Enhancing diagnostic quality in dental bitewings using transformer and GAN-Based image restoration
studies.keyFindings: The Swin Transformer-based super-resolution model (SwinIR) achieved higher PSNR (35.56 dB) and SSIM (0.9287) than Real-ESRGAN (31.93 dB, 0.8227) for restoring bitewing radiographs, with clinicians favoring SwinIR for diagnostic structure preservation.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Advanced deep learning techniques for classifying dental conditions using panoramic X-ray images
studies.keyFindings: A hybrid CNN-Random Forest model achieved the highest accuracy (85.4 ± 2.3%, macro-F1 0.843 ± 0.028) among evaluated deep learning techniques for detecting four dental conditions in manually annotated panoramic radiographs.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Image Processing-Based Automatic Tooth Segmentation and Age Estimation in Sheep Using Deep Learning
studies.keyFindings: A deep learning framework using automatic tooth segmentation achieved up to 95% accuracy in classifying sheep age groups based on dental images.
studies.journal: Annals of anatomy = Anatomischer Anzeiger : official organ of the Anatomische Gesellschaft
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Classifying Delayed Dental Care Using Machine Learning: A National Health Interview Survey Analysis
studies.keyFindings: Machine learning models, particularly LightGBM (accuracy = 84.87%), can identify US adults at risk for delayed dental care, which affects 14.5% of the surveyed population and is more prevalent in specific demographic groups.

studies.title: Comparison of Artificial Intelligence Models for Automatic Segmentation of the Mandibular Canals and Branches
studies.keyFindings: The 3D UX-Net model with postprocessing achieved the highest segmentation accuracy for mandibular canals and branches on CBCT scans, outperforming other models with a mean DSC of 0.788, IoU of 0.652, HD95 of 0.23 mm, ASSD of 0.083 mm, precision of 72.7%, and recall of 87.0%.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Prediction of skeletal maturity using machine learning based on multiple biological indicators
studies.keyFindings: A machine learning model using dental maturation stage, cervical vertebral morphology, age, and gender achieved an AUC of 0.924 for predicting skeletal maturity stages in a sample of 860 orthodontic patients.
studies.journal: American journal of orthodontics and dentofacial orthopedics : official publication of the American Association of Orthodontists, its constituent societies, and the American Board of Orthodontics
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Sex estimation based on odontometry of maxillary anterior teeth and arch dimensions predicted by machine learning algorithms
studies.keyFindings: Sex estimation from maxillary anterior tooth and arch measurements using six machine learning models achieved the highest accuracy of 94.5% with a Support Vector Classifier as estimated by nested cross-validation in 200 subjects.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: A comparative analysis of embedded chatbot models and ChatGPT-4 for answering orthodontic treatment queries
studies.keyFindings: The study compared embedded chatbot models and ChatGPT-4 for answering orthodontic treatment queries.

studies.title: A Unified Deep Learning Framework for Visual Diagnosis of Palatal Radicular Grooves in CBCT Scans: A Multi-Center Validation Study
studies.keyFindings: PRG-Net, a deep learning framework, achieved a mean DSC of 97.1% for tooth segmentation and AUCs ranging from 85.2% to 94.4% for PRG diagnosis across internal and external CBCT datasets, and improved dentists' diagnostic accuracy, classification agreement, and workflow efficiency.

studies.title: Artificial Intelligence-assisted Diagnosis of Carotid Artery Calcifications on Panoramic Radiographs: A Meta-analysis
studies.keyFindings: This meta-analysis of 7 studies found AI-assisted diagnosis of carotid artery calcifications on panoramic radiographs yielded pooled per-side sensitivity of 0.88 and specificity of 0.94, and per-person sensitivity of 0.90 and specificity of 0.81.

studies.title: Dual Framework for Classification and Detection of Third Molar Impaction in Panoramic Radiographs
studies.keyFindings: Two deep learning frameworks for detecting and classifying third molar impactions on 5796 panoramic radiographs demonstrated high performance, with the best classifier achieving 97.56% accuracy and the best detector reaching a mean average precision of 88.9%.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Untargeted Metabolomic and Lipidomic Profiles of Gingival Crevicular Fluid in the Context of Periodontitis
studies.keyFindings: Untargeted metabolomic and lipidomic analysis of gingival crevicular fluid revealed 256 metabolites, with significant differences found between healthy individuals and periodontitis patients.

studies.title: Exploring the role of AI in dental education: a mixed-method experimental study from Pakistan
studies.keyFindings: The study explores the role of AI in dental education in Pakistan using a mixed-method experimental approach.

studies.title: AI in endodontics: enhancing precision, efficiency, and personalized care
studies.keyFindings: This review discusses how AI applications, including convolutional and artificial neural networks, are transforming various aspects of endodontics such as diagnosis, treatment planning, and workflow efficiency, while also outlining current challenges and future directions.

studies.title: Utilization of teledentistry in rural areas: a scoping review
studies.keyFindings: A scoping review of 13 papers found that teledentistry has diverse applications in rural areas, including screening, diagnosis, oral health support, and referrals, with some evidence of reduced access time and acceptable patient satisfaction.

studies.title: An Exploratory Evaluation of GPT-5 in Periodontitis Staging and Grading Using Published Clinical Cases
studies.keyFindings: GPT-5 achieved 68.0% accuracy (Cohen's kappa 0.432) for staging and 77.3% accuracy (Cohen's kappa 0.179) for grading of periodontitis across 25 published clinical cases, with performance limitations particularly noted for grading.

studies.title: Enhancing dental clinical education through AI: insights into post-clinical summaries
studies.keyFindings: In a survey of 54 dental trainees, 77.78% agreed that AI tools support post-clinical summary activities, particularly in knowledge review and diagnostic reasoning, while perceived benefits for professionalism and ethics were less evident.

studies.title: Periodontitis Prediction Model Using Linked Electronic Health and Dental Records
studies.keyFindings: A machine learning model using linked dental and medical records predicted periodontitis with 84% AUC, 85% specificity, and 67% sensitivity, but dental factors remained the strongest predictors.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Advances in β-titanium alloys for safer and greener biomedical implants
studies.keyFindings: This review summarizes recent progress in the development and evaluation of β-titanium alloys for biomedical, including dental, implants, with discussion of AI and computational methods for alloy optimization.

studies.title: Clinical decision accuracy in endodontic treatment of patients with systemic diseases: a comparative analysis using different artificial intelligence models
studies.keyFindings: Across 40 standardized endodontic scenarios involving systemic diseases, no statistically significant differences were observed in overall clinical decision accuracy or domain-specific scores among the four AI models tested.

studies.title: Oral radiologists and orthodontists' attitude regarding the use of artificial intelligence for cephalometric analysis
studies.keyFindings: Brazilian orthodontists and oral radiologists report positive attitudes and confidence toward using AI for cephalometric analysis, with 78.4% supporting fully automated software for landmark identification.
studies.journal: Journal of orofacial orthopedics = Fortschritte der Kieferorthopadie : Organ/official journal Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Kieferorthopadie

studies.title: Editorial: VR-haptic technologies and their applications in dental education
studies.keyFindings: The abstract does not provide a summary of findings regarding VR-haptic technologies in dental education.

studies.title: Advanced Diagnostic Technologies and Molecular Biomarkers in Periodontitis: Systemic Health Implications and Translational Perspectives
studies.keyFindings: Recent advances in point-of-care diagnostics and molecular biomarkers for periodontitis show promise for future clinical application, but widespread clinical translation is limited by study heterogeneity, spectrum bias, and lack of external validation.

studies.title: A Hybrid Deep Learning Framework for Automated Dental Disorder Diagnosis from X-Ray Images
studies.keyFindings: A hybrid LSTM-based deep learning model combining HOG features, DenseNet-201, and Swin Transformer achieved 96.47% accuracy, 91.76% specificity, 94.92% precision, 91.76% recall, and 93.14% F1-score for automated dental disorder diagnosis on the DRAD dataset.

studies.title: Structure of AI Responses With Complex Patient Analysis for Patient Alternatives and Patient Modifiers
studies.keyFindings: Microsoft Copilot generated extensive categorised responses to dental treatment planning prompts, focusing on patient modifying factors, capacity, and prognoses, without providing recommendations.
studies.journal: European journal of dental education : official journal of the Association for Dental Education in Europe

studies.title: The effectiveness of large language models in dental specialty questions: a comparative study in the field of prosthodontics
studies.keyFindings: Among four large language models evaluated on 128 Dentistry Specialization Exam prosthodontic questions, Gemini 2.5 Pro achieved the highest accuracy for case-based questions (91%) using a sequential query protocol, while all models performed better on knowledge-based questions with significant differences noted between models and querying protocols.
studies.studyDesign: Benchmarking study on historical exam questions

studies.title: How to undertake oral medicine dosage calculations
studies.keyFindings: The article highlights strategies, including generative AI, that may reduce oral medicine dosage calculation errors in nursing practice.
studies.journal: Nursing standard (Royal College of Nursing (Great Britain) : 1987)

studies.title: CLAIRE: a unified framework for reporting and assessing artificial intelligence in diagnostic imaging
studies.keyFindings: The CLAIRE framework was retrospectively applied to 10 medical and dental imaging studies, yielding a 15-item checklist with high inter-rater reliability (Cohen's κ improved from 0.286 to 0.987) and a mean intra-rater reliability of 0.997 after a six-month washout.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Dental Students' Knowledge, Attitudes and Perceptions of Artificial Intelligence Tools to Aid in the Diagnosis of Oral Cancer and Oral Potentially Malignant Disorders
studies.keyFindings: Among 328 final-year European dental students, 61% reported a lack of formal AI training for diagnosing oral cancer and OPMDs, highlighting significant knowledge gaps and a need for curriculum integration.

studies.title: AI-driven automation of occlusal surface design in digital prosthodontics: a clinically validated workflow
studies.keyFindings: The study reports an AI-driven workflow for automation of occlusal surface design in digital prosthodontics that is clinically validated.

studies.title: Application of Artificial Intelligence in Education of Prosthodontics and Implant Dentistry: A Review
studies.keyFindings: AI has multiple applications in prosthodontic and implant dentistry education, including in theoretical learning, skills training, and assessment, but faces challenges related to academic integrity, bias, and privacy.
studies.journal: Advances in medical education and practice

studies.title: Application of artificial intelligence in oral health management: challenges and opportunities
studies.keyFindings: Artificial intelligence has multiple promising applications in oral health management, but data consistency, availability, reliability, and fairness remain key challenges.

studies.title: A Scoping Review on Synthetic Datasets: Opportunities, Challenges and Future Directions for Endodontics
studies.keyFindings: Eleven studies on synthetic data for endodontics were identified, primarily using GAN models for a range of imaging modalities, with combined real and synthetic data improving diagnostic task accuracy in four studies evaluating clinical utility.

studies.title: Large language model use in oral and maxillofacial surgery training: a national resident survey
studies.keyFindings: The study surveyed oral and maxillofacial surgery residents nationally regarding their use of large language models in training.

studies.title: Reply to Artificial intelligence-assisted triage in dentistry: toward reliable, scalable, and clinically aligned front-door decision support
studies.keyFindings: No findings are presented as only a reply letter title and no abstract content are provided.
studies.journal: Oral surgery, oral medicine, oral pathology and oral radiology

studies.title: Artificial intelligence-assisted triage in dentistry: toward reliable, scalable, and clinically aligned front-door decision support
studies.keyFindings: The abstract discusses the potential of AI-assisted triage to provide reliable, scalable, and clinically aligned decision support in dentistry, but does not report study results.
studies.journal: Oral surgery, oral medicine, oral pathology and oral radiology

studies.title: From Clinic to Community: An Interpretable Artificial Intelligence Framework for Enamel Caries Detection to Support Public Health Dentistry
studies.keyFindings: An interpretable fused deep learning model achieved 96.92% accuracy, F1 score of 96.92, and ROC AUC of 99.34 for enamel caries detection on an augmented dataset of 12,000 clinical dental images.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Preparing the AI-Ready Dentist: A Call for a Competency Framework in Dental Education
studies.keyFindings: The paper calls for the integration of AI competency frameworks into dental education to prepare an AI-proficient workforce.

studies.title: Inadequate Preventive Dental Care Is Associated With Higher Cardiovascular Risk Identified by ECG-Based Artificial Intelligence Algorithms
studies.keyFindings: Among 266,637 patients, inadequate preventive dental care was associated with higher AI-ECG-estimated risks of cardiovascular disease and all-cause mortality.
studies.journal: Journal of the American Heart Association

studies.title: IGMNN: a diagnosis method for vertical root fractures based on an information gated memory neural network
studies.keyFindings: The proposed Information-Gated Memory Neural Network (IGMNN) achieved specific classification accuracies on a CBCT dataset of 392 individuals for diagnosing vertical root fractures, distinguishing between cases with and without artifacts.

studies.title: Diagnostic Capabilities of Large Language Models in Paediatric Dentistry
studies.keyFindings: Both Copilot and Gemini LLMs achieved over 70% accuracy in identifying pathological locations and about 60% accuracy in making diagnoses in simulated pediatric dentistry exam cases, with performance decreasing notably when chief complaint information was omitted.

studies.title: Automated artificial intelligence-driven 3-dimensional craniofacial superimposition for clinically useful treatment outcomes in growing patients: A multicenter study
studies.keyFindings: A fully automated, AI-driven, open-source 3D craniofacial superimposition workflow showed high agreement and comparable clinical precision with conventional methods for measuring skeletal and dental changes in 22 growing Class II patients.
studies.journal: American journal of orthodontics and dentofacial orthopedics : official publication of the American Association of Orthodontists, its constituent societies, and the American Board of Orthodontics

studies.title: Artificial intelligence facilitated smile design for the rehabilitation of a fully maxillary edentulous patient with a complete arch implant-supported prosthesis: A dental technique
studies.keyFindings: The abstract describes how an AI-facilitated digital workflow was used to streamline esthetic rehabilitation of a fully edentulous maxilla with a complete-arch implant-supported prosthesis.
studies.journal: Journal of prosthodontics : official journal of the American College of Prosthodontists

studies.title: Clinical-imaging model for predicting prognosis in contemporary endodontic microsurgery: a retrospective machine learning-based study
studies.keyFindings: A random forest model trained on 213 teeth achieved 91% accuracy, 91% sensitivity, 85% specificity, and AUC of 0.97 for predicting endodontic microsurgery prognosis using clinical and imaging features.

studies.title: Statistical considerations in machine learning-based prediction of early childhood caries
studies.keyFindings: The study discusses statistical considerations in machine learning-based prediction of early childhood caries.
studies.journal: European archives of paediatric dentistry : official journal of the European Academy of Paediatric Dentistry

studies.title: Trends and Research Hotspots in Technology-Enhanced Dental Education: A Bibliometric Analysis
studies.keyFindings: Between 2015 and 2025, 749 publications in technology-enhanced dental education showed an annual growth rate of 12.47%, with a thematic shift toward digital and simulation-based learning after 2020.
studies.journal: European journal of dental education : official journal of the Association for Dental Education in Europe

studies.title: Antibacterial and Bioregenerative Nanomaterials in Oral Health: From Material Design to Clinical Translation and Technological Trends
studies.keyFindings: Antibacterial and bioregenerative nanomaterials show potential in restorative dentistry, but evidence is mainly from heterogeneous in vitro and preclinical studies, with limited clinical applicability claims.

studies.title: International Perspectives on Digital and Generative AI Adoption and Governance in Undergraduate Dental Education: A Cross-Sectional Survey
studies.keyFindings: Digital and generative AI technologies are being adopted unevenly across undergraduate dental institutions globally, with 97 respondents from 38 countries reporting variable use and frequent lack of institutional governance.

studies.title: Human and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Analysis of Patient Experiences of Periodontal Graft Surgery
studies.keyFindings: Human and AI-assisted qualitative analysis of 19 YouTube videos identified nine key themes related to patient experiences of periodontal graft surgery, with most themes overlapping between human and AI analyses.

studies.title: Evaluating the Test Characteristics of a Prototype for AI-Assisted Radiographic Detection
studies.keyFindings: An AI-assisted prototype demonstrated sensitivity greater than 82% and specificity greater than 93% for most dental pathology classes across 400 radiographs, but had limitations in detecting bone loss, impacted canines, recurrent caries under fillings/crowns, and distinguishing extensive fillings from crowns.

studies.title: Artificial Intelligence Models for the Detection and Quantification of Orthodontically Induced Root Resorption Using Cone-Beam Computed Tomography: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
studies.keyFindings: In a systematic review and meta-analysis of seven studies, AI models using CBCT for detecting orthodontically induced root resorption achieved pooled sensitivity of 0.903 (95% CI: 0.818-0.989), specificity ranging from 82% to 98%, and near-perfect agreement (ICC 1.000) with manual reference standards.

studies.title: Assessing the Efficacy of Artificial Intelligence Platforms in Answering Dental Caries Multiple-Choice Questions: A Comparative Study of ChatGPT and Google Gemini Language Models
studies.keyFindings: Gemini significantly outperformed ChatGPT in answering 1,400 simulated dental caries multiple-choice exams across varying test lengths, with higher mean scores and passing rates (p<0.001).

studies.title: Current Applications and Future Perspectives of Artificial Intelligence in Face-Driven Orthodontics: A Scoping Review
studies.keyFindings: AI applications in face-driven orthodontics show promise for diagnosis, soft-tissue assessment, and individualized treatment planning, but current evidence is limited by heterogeneous datasets and lack of standardized and external validation.

studies.title: AI in medical and dentistry education: perspectives from international students, educators and physicians
studies.keyFindings: The study discusses perspectives on AI in medical and dental education from international students, educators, and physicians.

studies.title: Clinically interpretable deep learning for pediatric dental age estimation with explainable AI
studies.keyFindings: The study reports on a clinically interpretable deep learning approach for pediatric dental age estimation with explainable AI.

studies.title: AI-Powered Intraoperative Navigation Photogrammetry for Complete-Arch Implant Impression and Immediate Loading With a 3D-Printed Temporary Prosthesis: A Prospective Clinical Study
studies.keyFindings: In 19 patients (24 arches), an AI-guided photogrammetry system enabled quick, reliable intraoperative complete-arch implant impressions and immediate delivery of 3D-printed temporary prostheses, with high patient satisfaction and no reported complications at 6 months.
studies.journal: Journal of esthetic and restorative dentistry : official publication of the American Academy of Esthetic Dentistry ... [et al.]

studies.title: Automated deep learning detection of orthodontically induced external apical root resorption in maxillary incisors on panoramic radiographs
studies.keyFindings: A YOLOv12-based pose estimation deep learning model achieved a weighted F1-score of 0.88 and higher overall accuracy (0.93) than object detection for classifying orthodontically induced external apical root resorption on 624 panoramic radiographs.

studies.title: A Novel Hybrid Large Language Model Approach for Reporting Panoramic Radiographs and Performance Comparison with Current Large Language Models
studies.keyFindings: A hybrid framework combining deep learning-based image analysis and LLM-driven reporting improved accuracy and reduced hallucinations when reporting on panoramic dental radiographs, with DeepSeek R1 achieving the highest reporting accuracy and lowest hallucination counts among evaluated LLMs.
studies.journal: Journal of imaging informatics in medicine
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: The role of dentists in the recognition of neurodegenerative and systemic conditions with neurological involvement
studies.keyFindings: This review summarizes orofacial manifestations, dental care challenges, and strategies for early recognition and referral of neurological diseases in dental settings, and advocates for the future integration of AI and other emerging technologies.
studies.journal: Oral surgery, oral medicine, oral pathology and oral radiology

studies.title: Modernizing Forensic Anthropology: A Data-driven Pipeline for Human Identification and Profiling
studies.keyFindings: This narrative review summarizes advances in imaging, geometric morphometrics, and AI for improving dental human identification and profiling in forensic odontology.

studies.title: Evaluation of Large Language Models for Clinical Sign-Based Oral Assessment in Dogs Compared With Veterinary Practitioners
studies.keyFindings: Novice veterinarians showed higher diagnostic consistency and agreement with expert consensus than all evaluated LLMs in canine oral assessment, with LLM diagnostic accuracy ranging from 33.3% to 95%.

studies.title: Effectiveness of Artificial Intelligence Models for Detection of Vertical Root Fractures: A Systematic Review
studies.keyFindings: CNN-based AI models trained on high-resolution CBCT images can achieve 75% to 97.8% accuracy for vertical root fracture detection, but overall evidence certainty is low due to small sample sizes and limited external validation.

studies.title: MICCAI STS 2024 challenge: Semi-supervised instance-level tooth segmentation in panoramic X-ray and CBCT images
studies.keyFindings: In the STS 2024 challenge, semi-supervised instance-level tooth segmentation models outperformed a fully-supervised nnU-Net baseline by over 44 percentage points (OPG, Instance Affinity) and 61 percentage points (CBCT, Instance Dice) using a large, publicly available dataset.

studies.title: Automated Identification of Accessory Mental Foramen Using Cone-Beam Computed Tomography and Convolutional Neural Networks
studies.keyFindings: A ResNet-50 model achieved 85.8% accuracy for automatic detection of accessory mental foramen on CBCT, outperforming a custom CNN (71.1% accuracy), with supporting precision, recall, and interpretability analyses.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: A Deep Metric Learning and Multimodal Gated Fusion Framework for AI-Driven Risk Assessment of Lingual Plate Perforation and Mandibular Canal Injury in Posterior Mandible Implants
studies.keyFindings: The proposed AI multimodal model (DentaRisk-Net) achieved accuracy above 0.87 and precision and recall above 0.84 for automated risk assessment of lingual plate perforation and mandibular canal injury on 896 CBCT-implant records, showing higher performance for Safe and Risk classes than for Caution.
studies.studyDesign: Algorithm development and internal validation study

studies.title: Robots at the Chairside: A Narrative Review of Robotic-Assisted Surgery Revolutionizing Dental Implantology in the Digital Dentistry Era
studies.keyFindings: Robotic-assisted technologies have introduced advances in dental implantology through enhanced surgical precision, safety, and potential clinical benefits, but ongoing evaluation is needed.
